mathematicians.name: Euclid
mathematicians.known_for: Systematically developed the foundations of geometry in his work 'Elements'.

mathematicians.name: Archimedes
mathematicians.known_for: Calculated areas and volumes using the method of exhaustion and discovered the principle of buoyancy.

mathematicians.name: Pythagoras
mathematicians.known_for: Formulated the Pythagorean theorem relating the sides of a right triangle.

mathematicians.name: Hypatia
mathematicians.known_for: Commented on Diophantus's work and contributed to the understanding of conic sections.

mathematicians.name: Brahmagupta
mathematicians.known_for: Introduced rules for arithmetic operations involving zero and negative numbers.

mathematicians.name: Al-Khwarizmi
mathematicians.known_for: Developed systematic methods for solving linear and quadratic equations, giving rise to the term 'algorithm'.

mathematicians.name: Diophantus
mathematicians.known_for: Pioneered the study of equations with integer solutions, known as Diophantine equations.

mathematicians.name: Ptolemy
mathematicians.known_for: Developed a mathematical model of the solar system and created trigonometric tables.

mathematicians.name: Thales
mathematicians.known_for: Established theorems in geometry and is credited with predicting a solar eclipse.

mathematicians.name: Eratosthenes
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Sieve of Eratosthenes for finding prime numbers.

mathematicians.name: Apollonius
mathematicians.known_for: Systematically studied conic sections and their properties.

mathematicians.name: Hero of Alexandria
mathematicians.known_for: Invented the formula for calculating the area of a triangle given its three sides.

mathematicians.name: Nicomachus
mathematicians.known_for: Classified numbers into categories such as perfect, abundant, and deficient numbers.

mathematicians.name: Pappus
mathematicians.known_for: Formulated Pappus's theorem in projective geometry.

mathematicians.name: Zu Chongzhi
mathematicians.known_for: Calculated an accurate approximation of π and contributed to the development of the calendar.

mathematicians.name: Sushruta
mathematicians.known_for: Developed early surgical techniques and is considered the father of surgery.

mathematicians.name: Aryabhata
mathematicians.known_for: Introduced the concept of zero and made significant contributions to trigonometry and astronomy.

mathematicians.name: Manava
mathematicians.known_for: Wrote the Manava Sulba Sutra, which contains early geometric constructions for altars.

mathematicians.name: Jain mathematicians
mathematicians.known_for: Advanced the understanding of infinite series and combinatorial mathematics in ancient India.

mathematicians.name: Heron of Alexandria
mathematicians.known_for: Developed Heron's formula for calculating the area of a triangle given its side lengths.

mathematicians.name: Leonardo Fibonacci
mathematicians.known_for: Introduced the Fibonacci sequence to the Western world.

mathematicians.name: Niccolò Tartaglia
mathematicians.known_for: Solved cubic equations and published the solution in his work 'General Trattato'.

mathematicians.name: Gerolamo Cardano
mathematicians.known_for: Published the general solution to cubic equations and made early contributions to probability theory.

mathematicians.name: François Viète
mathematicians.known_for: Pioneered the use of letters to represent unknowns and constants in algebra.

mathematicians.name: René Descartes
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Cartesian coordinate system and laid the foundation for analytic geometry.

mathematicians.name: Pierre de Fermat
mathematicians.known_for: Formulated Fermat's Last Theorem and made foundational contributions to number theory.

mathematicians.name: Blaise Pascal
mathematicians.known_for: Invented the mechanical calculator and made key contributions to probability and projective geometry.

mathematicians.name: Isaac Newton
mathematicians.known_for: Developed calculus and formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation.

mathematicians.name: Gottfried Leibniz
mathematicians.known_for: Co-invented calculus and made significant contributions to symbolic logic and binary systems.

mathematicians.name: Jacob Bernoulli
mathematicians.known_for: Made foundational contributions to probability theory and introduced Bernoulli numbers.

mathematicians.name: Johann Bernoulli
mathematicians.known_for: Made significant contributions to calculus and pioneered the calculus of variations.

mathematicians.name: Leonhard Euler
mathematicians.known_for: Revolutionized mathematical analysis and introduced much of the modern mathematical notation.

mathematicians.name: Pierre-Simon Laplace
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the mathematical foundations of probability theory and celestial mechanics.

mathematicians.name: Joseph-Louis Lagrange
mathematicians.known_for: Formulated the principle of least action and made foundational contributions to number theory and mechanics.

mathematicians.name: Évariste Galois
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the mathematical theory of groups and laid the foundation for modern algebra.

mathematicians.name: Srinivasa Ramanujan
mathematicians.known_for: Made extraordinary contributions to number theory and mathematical analysis, particularly in infinite series and continued fractions.

mathematicians.name: Emmy Noether
mathematicians.known_for: Pioneered abstract algebra and proved Noether's theorem, linking symmetry and conservation laws in physics.

mathematicians.name: Sophie Germain
mathematicians.known_for: Made significant contributions to number theory and elasticity theory, particularly in Fermat's Last Theorem.

mathematicians.name: Mary Somerville
mathematicians.known_for: Popularized mathematics and astronomy, translating and expanding on Laplace's work.

mathematicians.name: Karl Friedrich Gauss
mathematicians.known_for: Known as the 'Prince of Mathematics' for his foundational contributions to number theory and statistics.

mathematicians.name: Émilie du Châtelet
mathematicians.known_for: Translated Newton's Principia and made significant contributions to the understanding of energy and motion.

mathematicians.name: Madhava of Sangamagrama
mathematicians.known_for: Developed infinite series expansions for trigonometric functions and is considered the founder of mathematical analysis.

mathematicians.name: Bhāskara II
mathematicians.known_for: Made significant contributions to algebra, calculus, and astronomy, including solutions to indeterminate equations.

mathematicians.name: Carl Friedrich Gauss
mathematicians.known_for: Known as the 'Prince of Mathematics' for his foundational contributions to number theory and statistics.

mathematicians.name: Émile Borel
mathematicians.known_for: Pioneered measure theory and probability, and introduced the concept of Borel sets.

mathematicians.name: Henri Poincaré
mathematicians.known_for: Pioneered topology and made foundational contributions to dynamical systems and celestial mechanics.

mathematicians.name: David Hilbert
mathematicians.known_for: Formulated 23 famous problems that shaped 20th-century mathematics and contributed to formalism in logic.

mathematicians.name: Félix Klein
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Erlangen Program, unifying geometry through group theory.

mathematicians.name: Georg Cantor
mathematicians.known_for: Invented set theory and proved that infinity comes in different sizes.

mathematicians.name: Bernhard Riemann
mathematicians.known_for: Developed Riemannian geometry, foundational for Einstein's general relativity.

mathematicians.name: Émile Picard
mathematicians.known_for: Advanced complex analysis and proved the Picard theorem on entire functions.

mathematicians.name: Charles Émile Jordan
mathematicians.known_for: Contributed significantly to group theory and the Jordan canonical form.

mathematicians.name: Pafnuty Chebyshev
mathematicians.known_for: Advanced prime number theory and introduced Chebyshev polynomials.

mathematicians.name: Andrey Markov
mathematicians.known_for: Invented Markov chains and made major contributions to probability theory.

mathematicians.name: Sofia Kovalevskaya
mathematicians.known_for: Solved the Cauchy problem for partial differential equations and became the first woman to hold a full professorship in Northern Europe.

mathematicians.name: Ferdinand Georg Frobenius
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the theory of Frobenius groups and made significant contributions to representation theory.

mathematicians.name: Niels Henrik Abel
mathematicians.known_for: Proved the impossibility of solving the quintic equation in radicals and made foundational contributions to elliptic functions.

mathematicians.name: Augustin-Louis Cauchy
mathematicians.known_for: Formalized calculus and made fundamental contributions to complex analysis and group theory.

mathematicians.name: Jean le Rond d'Alembert
mathematicians.known_for: Contributed to differential equations and the wave equation, and co-edited the Encyclopédie.

mathematicians.name: Joseph Liouville
mathematicians.known_for: Made important contributions to number theory, complex analysis, and proved the existence of transcendental numbers.

mathematicians.name: Thomas Bayes
mathematicians.known_for: Developed Bayes' theorem, a fundamental result in probability theory and statistics.

mathematicians.name: William Rowan Hamilton
mathematicians.known_for: Invented quaternions and made significant contributions to optics and mechanics.

mathematicians.name: Georges Lemaître
mathematicians.known_for: Proposed the Big Bang theory of the universe's origin.

mathematicians.name: Felix Klein
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Erlangen Program, unifying geometry and group theory.

mathematicians.name: Leopold Kronecker
mathematicians.known_for: Contributed significantly to number theory and algebra, known for Kronecker's theorem.

mathematicians.name: Karl Weierstrass
mathematicians.known_for: Known as the father of modern analysis for rigorously defining continuity and convergence.

mathematicians.name: Emile Borel
mathematicians.known_for: Made foundational contributions to probability theory and measure theory.

mathematicians.name: Andrey Kolmogorov
mathematicians.known_for: Established the axiomatic foundations of probability theory.

mathematicians.name: John von Neumann
mathematicians.known_for: Made major contributions to set theory, quantum mechanics, and computer science.

mathematicians.name: Alan Turing
mathematicians.known_for: Laid the theoretical foundations of computer science and artificial intelligence.

mathematicians.name: Kurt Gödel
mathematicians.known_for: Proved his incompleteness theorems, showing the limits of formal systems.

mathematicians.name: Emil Artin
mathematicians.known_for: Made significant contributions to algebraic number theory and group theory.

mathematicians.name: Leroy Hood
mathematicians.known_for: Contributed to mathematical biology and systems biology.

mathematicians.name: Benoit Mandelbrot
mathematicians.known_for: Coined the term 'fractal' and pioneered the study of fractal geometry.

mathematicians.name: Paul Erdős
mathematicians.known_for: One of the most prolific mathematicians, known for his work in combinatorics and number theory.

mathematicians.name: John Nash
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Nash equilibrium in game theory and made significant contributions to differential geometry and partial differential equations.

mathematicians.name: Alexander Grothendieck
mathematicians.known_for: Revolutionized algebraic geometry through the development of schemes and cohomology theories.

mathematicians.name: Serge Lang
mathematicians.known_for: Made significant contributions to number theory, algebraic geometry, and analysis, and authored influential textbooks.

mathematicians.name: Hermann Weyl
mathematicians.known_for: Contributed to quantum mechanics, differential geometry, and the foundations of mathematics, known for the Weyl tensor and Weyl's theorem.

mathematicians.name: Norbert Wiener
mathematicians.known_for: Founded the field of cybernetics and made major contributions to probability theory and harmonic analysis.

mathematicians.name: Emile Picard
mathematicians.known_for: Contributed to complex analysis, differential equations, and the theory of functions, known for the Picard theorem.

mathematicians.name: John Milnor
mathematicians.known_for: Made groundbreaking contributions to topology, differential geometry, and dynamical systems, including the discovery of exotic spheres.

mathematicians.name: Michael Atiyah
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Atiyah-Singer index theorem and made significant contributions to K-theory and gauge theory.

mathematicians.name: Friedrich Frobenius
mathematicians.known_for: Advanced group theory and representation theory, known for the Frobenius theorem and Frobenius endomorphism.

mathematicians.name: László Lovász
mathematicians.known_for: Made fundamental contributions to combinatorics, graph theory, and theoretical computer science, including the Lovász local lemma.

mathematicians.name: Terence Tao
mathematicians.known_for: Made profound contributions to harmonic analysis, partial differential equations, and number theory, including the Green-Tao theorem.

mathematicians.name: Grigori Perelman
mathematicians.known_for: Solved the Poincaré conjecture and the Thurston geometrization conjecture using Ricci flow.

mathematicians.name: Andrew Wiles
mathematicians.known_for: Proved Fermat's Last Theorem using elliptic curves and modular forms.

mathematicians.name: William Thurston
mathematicians.known_for: Revolutionized 3-manifold topology and geometric structures, known for the geometrization conjecture.

mathematicians.name: Maryam Mirzakhani
mathematicians.known_for: Made groundbreaking contributions to the dynamics and geometry of Riemann surfaces and their moduli spaces.

mathematicians.name: John Conway
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Game of Life and made significant contributions to group theory, number theory, and combinatorial game theory.

mathematicians.name: Donald Knuth
mathematicians.known_for: Created the TeX typesetting system and authored the multi-volume 'The Art of Computer Programming'.

mathematicians.name: Shing-Tung Yau
mathematicians.known_for: Proved the Calabi conjecture and made groundbreaking contributions to differential geometry and mathematical physics.

mathematicians.name: Peter Scholze
mathematicians.known_for: Developed perfectoid spaces, revolutionizing number theory and arithmetic geometry.

mathematicians.name: Cédric Villani
mathematicians.known_for: Won the Fields Medal for his work on the Boltzmann equation and optimal transport theory.

mathematicians.name: Vladimir Arnold
mathematicians.known_for: Made fundamental contributions to dynamical systems, topology, and mathematical physics.

mathematicians.name: John H. Conway
mathematicians.known_for: Developed the Game of Life and made significant contributions to group theory, number theory, and combinatorial game theory.

mathematicians.name: Lars Valerian Ahlfors
mathematicians.known_for: Won the Fields Medal for his work in complex analysis and geometric function theory.

mathematicians.name: Sergei Novikov
mathematicians.known_for: Won the Fields Medal for his work in topology and the theory of dynamical systems.

mathematicians.name: Pierre Deligne
mathematicians.known_for: Proved the Weil conjectures and made foundational contributions to algebraic geometry.

mathematicians.name: Katherine Johnson
mathematicians.known_for: Calculated orbital mechanics for early NASA space missions, including John Glenn's flight.

mathematicians.name: Terry Tao
mathematicians.known_for: Made profound contributions across multiple areas of mathematics, including harmonic analysis and number theory.

mathematicians.name: Alexandre Grothendieck
mathematicians.known_for: Revolutionized algebraic geometry through the development of schemes and étale cohomology.

mathematicians.name: Nicolas Bourbaki
mathematicians.known_for: A collective pseudonym for a group of mathematicians who published under the name to promote rigorous foundations of mathematics.
